Note.value: CodaMail is an email service provided by Packetderm, LLC (USA, Massachusetts), also known through Cotse.Net, with a strong focus on safeguarding user privacy. Accessible via https://codamail.com, CodaMail combines minimal data collection with robust encryption, offering a secure communication solution centered on privacy and user control.  Security & Anonymity: CodaMail ensures a high level of privacy through strict principles: it collects only the bare minimum of data (account name, subscription details, creation/expiration dates), and email content is individually encrypted at rest using elliptic-curve AES-GCM-256. It supports zero-access automatic PGP encryption and end-to-end encryption via PGP, making message content inaccessible even to the service operators. Server logs are retained for just 5 days for technical operations and abuse prevention, and no IP addresses are stored for VPN/proxy services, though Intrusion Detection may capture IPs during anomalies. Registration requires only a username and password (hashed with SHA512/yescrypt), with 2FA (TOTP) available for added security. However, CodaMail isn‚Äôt fully anonymous‚Äîpayments (via First Data/PayPal or cash) and U.S. jurisdiction may link a payer‚Äôs identity. Data isn‚Äôt sold or shared with third parties, except under valid U.S. legal requests (reviewed and challenged if overly broad, with user notification when allowed). For complete anonymity, using Tor and avoiding payment ties to real identity are recommended.  Use Cases: CodaMail is suitable for users who prioritize private correspondence with strong encryption and minimal data collection. It‚Äôs an excellent choice for:      Confidential communication using PGP (e.g., between tech-savvy users).     Individuals avoiding tracking by advertisers or analytics (no logs or tracking).     Those wanting control over access and encryption (e.g., via IMAP/POP3 settings and PGP keys). It‚Äôs not ideal for total anonymity (due to payments and U.S. jurisdiction) or bulk messaging (strict anti-spam measures). CodaMail is perfect for those who value security and are willing to manage their own keys and backups (no automatic backups to protect privacy), including professionals, privacy-conscious users, or small businesses needing secure email within the U.S. legal framework.

Note.value: ### Description of Disroot Email in English  **Disroot** is a platform provided by the non-profit organization Stichting Disroot.org (Netherlands), featuring an email service (https://webmail.disroot.org) among other tools for communication and collaboration. Disroot focuses on privacy, freedom, and ethical use of technology based on free and open-source software.  **Security & Anonymity:** Disroot offers a high level of privacy through minimal data collection and a strict protection policy. Account creation requires only a temporary email (deleted after approval unless kept for recovery), a username, and a password. Activity logs (IP, actions) are stored for just 24 hours and not archived, minimizing traces. Emails are stored on servers in the Netherlands unencrypted by default, but users can apply GnuPG/PGP for end-to-end encryption. Data transmission is secured with SSL/TLS, and servers use disk encryption. Data isn‚Äôt sold or shared with third parties, except as required by federated services (e.g., sending an email to Gmail reveals the recipient‚Äôs address). Full anonymity isn‚Äôt guaranteed due to email‚Äôs federated nature and lack of built-in encryption‚Äîusing VPN/Tor and self-encrypting emails is recommended for maximum protection. Losing a password results in irreversible access loss, as Disroot doesn‚Äôt hold master keys.  **Use Cases:** Disroot is suitable for users who value privacy, free speech, and a non-commercial approach to technology. It‚Äôs a good fit for: - Ethical correspondence with minimal tracking (especially with PGP encryption). - Activists, communities, or individuals avoiding corporate ecosystems and ads. - Those wanting to integrate email with other open services (Nextcloud, XMPP). It‚Äôs not suitable for commercial purposes (strictly prohibited), highly sensitive data without encryption, or users needing simplicity (requires technical awareness for optimal security). Disroot is ideal for open-source enthusiasts, small groups, or those willing to take security into their own hands within Dutch jurisdiction and GDPR compliance.
